intro: Ledebouria asperifolia, commonly known as the rough-leaved bulbous plant, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to South Africa, where it typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils. The plant produces a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves with a rough, sandpapery texture. During the growing season, it develops a tall, erect stem bearing clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and drought tolerance.
